sari9: 5 cups of water or chicken broth
sariTarif1: Wash and drain the yellow lentils.
sariTarif2: In a pot, heat the oil or butter and sauté the chopped onions until golden.
sariTarif3: Add the chopped carrots and potatoes, sauté for a few minutes.
sariTarif4: Add the washed yellow lentils to the pot and stir.
sariTarif5: Add salt, black pepper, and cumin, then pour in the water or chicken broth. Stir and bring to a boil.
sariTarif6: Once boiling, reduce the heat and simmer for about 20-25 minutes until the vegetables are completely tender.
sariTarif7: Blend the soup until smooth using a blender or immersion blender. If the soup is too thick, you can add more water.
sariTarif8: Return the soup to the stove and bring it to a boil again. Check the taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.
sariTarif9: Serve hot with lemon slices. Enjoy!
ispanak5: 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil or butter
ispanak6: 1 teaspoon of salt (adjust to your taste)
ispanak9: 5 cups of water or chicken broth
ispanakTarif1: Wash and drain the yellow lentils.
ispanakTarif2: In a pot, heat the oil or butter. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden.
ispanakTarif3: Add the chopped carrots and potatoes, and sauté for a few more minutes.
ispanakTarif4: Add the washed yellow lentils to the pot and stir.
ispanakTarif5: Add salt, black pepper, and cumin, then pour in the water or chicken broth. Stir and bring to a boil.
ispanakTarif6: Once the soup starts boiling, reduce the heat and simmer for about 20-25 minutes until the vegetables are completely tender.
ispanakTarif7: Blend the cooked soup until smooth using a blender or immersion blender. If the soup is too thick, you can add more water.
ispanakTarif8: Add the chopped spinach and cook for a few more minutes until the spinach is soft.
ispanakTarif9: Return the soup to the stove and bring it to a boil again. Check the taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
ispanakTarif10: Serve hot with lemon slices. Enjoy your meal!
kirmizi5: 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil or butter
kirmizi7: 1 teaspoon of salt (adjust to your taste)
kirmizi10: 6 cups of water or chicken broth
kirmiziTarif1: Wash and drain the red lentils.
kirmiziTarif2: In a pot, heat the oil or butter. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden.
kirmiziTarif3: Add the chopped carrots and potatoes, and sauté for a few more minutes.
kirmiziTarif4: Add the tomato paste and sauté until its aroma is released.
kirmiziTarif5: Add the washed red lentils to the pot and stir.
kirmiziTarif6: Add salt, black pepper, and cumin, then pour in the water or chicken broth. Stir and bring to a boil.
kirmiziTarif7: Once the soup starts boiling, reduce the heat and simmer for about 20-25 minutes until the vegetables are completely tender.
kirmiziTarif8: Blend the cooked soup until smooth using a blender or immersion blender. If the soup is too thick, you can add more water.
kirmiziTarif9: Return the soup to the stove and bring it to a boil again. Check the taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
kirmiziTarif10: Serve hot with lemon slices. Enjoy your meal!
sosisli5: 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil or butter
sosisli8: 1 teaspoon of salt (adjust to your taste)
sosisli11: 6 cups of water or chicken broth
sosisliTarif1: Wash and drain the red lentils.
sosisliTarif2: In a pot, heat the vegetable oil or butter. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden.
sosisliTarif3: Add the chopped carrots and potatoes, and sauté for a few more minutes.
sosisliTarif4: Add the tomato paste and cook until the raw smell is gone.
sosisliTarif5: Add the sliced sausages and sauté for a few minutes.
sosisliTarif6: Add the washed red lentils to the pot and stir.
sosisliTarif7: Add salt, black pepper, and cumin, then pour in the water or chicken broth. Stir and bring to a boil.
sosisliTarif8: Once the soup starts boiling, reduce the heat and simmer for about 20-25 minutes until the vegetables are completely tender.
sosisliTarif9: Blend the cooked soup until smooth using a blender or immersion blender. If the soup is too thick, you can add more water.
sosisliTarif10: Return the soup to the stove and bring it to a boil again. Check the taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
sosisliTarif11: Serve hot with lemon slices. Enjoy your meal!
nohutlu5: 3 cups of water or chicken broth
nohutluTarif1: Soak the rice in salted warm water for about 20-30 minutes. Then rinse and drain well.
nohutluTarif2: In a pot, add the butter and vegetable oil. Once the fats are melted, add the rice and sauté until the rice becomes translucent.
nohutluTarif3: Add the cooked chickpeas and stir.
nohutluTarif4: Add salt and black pepper, then pour in the water or chicken broth. Stir and bring to a boil.
nohutluTarif5: Once boiling, cover the pot and simmer on low heat until the rice has absorbed all the liquid.
nohutluTarif6: After the rice is cooked, remove from heat and let it sit, covered, for about 10-15 minutes to steam.
nohutluTarif7: Fluff the rice and serve. Enjoy your meal!
bademli5: 3 cups of water or chicken broth
bademliTarif1: Soak the rice in salted warm water for about 20-30 minutes. Then rinse and drain.
bademliTarif2: To easily peel the almonds, soak them in boiling water for a few minutes, then transfer to cold water and peel off the skins.
bademliTarif3: In a pot, add the butter and vegetable oil. Once the fats are melted, add the almonds and lightly toast them. (If using onion, add it with the almonds and sauté until the onion is golden.)
bademliTarif4: Add the rice and cook until the rice becomes translucent.
bademliTarif5: Add the salt and black pepper, then pour in the water or chicken broth. Stir and bring to a boil.
bademliTarif6: Once boiling, cover the pot and reduce the heat. Cook until the rice absorbs all the liquid.
bademliTarif7: After the pilaf is cooked, remove from heat and let it sit, covered, for about 10-15 minutes to steam.
bademliTarif8: Fluff the pilaf before serving. Enjoy your meal!
domatesli6: 3 cups of water or chicken broth
domatesliTarif1: Soak the rice in salted warm water for about 20-30 minutes. Then rinse and drain.
domatesliTarif2: In a pot, add the butter and vegetable oil. Once the fats have melted, add the chopped green peppers (if using) and sauté lightly.
domatesliTarif3: Add the grated tomatoes and cook until the tomatoes have absorbed their juice.
domatesliTarif4: Add the rice and cook until the rice becomes transparent.
domatesliTarif5: Add salt and black pepper, then pour in the water or chicken broth. Stir and bring to a boil.
domatesliTarif6: Once boiling, cover the pot and cook on low heat until the rice has absorbed the liquid.
domatesliTarif7: Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit, covered, for about 10-15 minutes to allow the rice to steam.
domatesliTarif8: Fluff the rice and serve. Enjoy your meal!
sebzeli7: 2 tablespoons of butter or vegetable oil
sebzeli8: 3 cups of water or chicken broth
sebzeliTarif1: In a pot, add the butter or vegetable oil. Once the oil is heated, add the finely chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
sebzeliTarif2: Add the chopped green and red peppers and cook until the peppers are tender.
sebzeliTarif3: Add the grated carrot and continue to cook for a few more minutes.
sebzeliTarif4: Add the grated tomatoes and cook until the tomatoes have absorbed their juice.
sebzeliTarif5: Add the bulgur and cook until the bulgur becomes transparent.
sebzeliTarif6: Add salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes. Then pour in the water or chicken broth and bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
sebzeliTarif7: Once boiling, cover the pot and cook on low heat until the bulgur has absorbed the liquid.
sebzeliTarif8: Remove from heat and let it sit, covered, for about 10-15 minutes to allow the pilaf to steam.
sebzeliTarif9: Fluff the pilaf and serve. Enjoy your meal!
akasya6: 2 tablespoons of butter or vegetable oil
akasya7: 3 cups of water or chicken broth
akasyaTarif1: Soak the rice in salted warm water for about 20-30 minutes. Then rinse and drain the rice.
akasyaTarif2: In a pot, add the butter or vegetable oil. Once heated, add the finely chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
akasyaTarif3: Add the diced chicken breast and cook until the chicken is fully cooked.
akasyaTarif4: Add the diced carrot and continue to sauté for a few minutes.
akasyaTarif6: Add the rice and cook until the rice becomes transparent.
akasyaTarif7: Add salt, black pepper, turmeric, and cumin. Then add the water or chicken broth and bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
akasyaTarif8: Once boiling, cover the pot and simmer until the rice absorbs the liquid.
akasyaTarif9: Remove from heat and let it sit, covered, for about 10-15 minutes to steam.
akasyaTarif10: Fluff the pilaf and serve. Enjoy your meal!
etli10: 4 cups of water or beef broth
etliTarif1: Place the diced beef in a pot and cook until it releases and absorbs its own juices. Then add olive oil and cook until the meat is browned.
etliTarif2: Add the finely chopped onion and garlic and sauté until the onions are translucent.
etliTarif3: Add the tomato paste and cook until the raw smell disappears. Then add the grated tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally.
etliTarif4: Add salt and black pepper. Stir in the bulgur and cook for a few minutes.
etliTarif5: Add water or beef broth and mix. Cover the pot and cook on low heat until the bulgur is tender.
etliTarif6: Once the pilaf is cooked, remove from heat and stir in the finely chopped parsley.
etliTarif7: Serve the meat bulgur pilaf hot. Enjoy your meal!
kuru5: 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil or butter
kuruTarif1: Soak the dried beans in a bowl covered with plenty of water overnight. If short on time, you can quickly boil them instead.
kuruTarif2: Place the boiled and drained beans in a pot. Add enough hot water to cover them and stir.
kuruTarif3: Heat the vegetable oil or butter in a pan. Add the chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
kuruTarif4: Add the tomato paste and continue to cook, then add the tomatoes.
kuruTarif5: Add the spices and optional red pepper flakes. Cook, stirring occasionally.
kuruTarif6: Add this mixture to the cooked beans and stir.
kuruTarif7: Cover the pot and simmer on low heat until the beans are tender. This usually takes about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Remember to stir occasionally.
kuruTarif8: Once the beans are tender and the sauce has thickened, remove from heat.
kuruTarif9: Serve hot with rice and pickles. Enjoy your meal!
etliKuru6: 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil or butter
etliKuruTarif1: Soak the dried beans in a bowl covered with plenty of water overnight. If short on time, you can quickly boil them instead.
etliKuruTarif2: Add vegetable oil or butter to a pot. Add the cubed beef and cook until it releases and absorbs its juices.
etliKuruTarif3: Add the finely chopped onions to the browned meat and continue to cook until the onions are translucent.
etliKuruTarif4: Once the onions are translucent, add the tomato paste and cook, then add the grated tomatoes and mix.
etliKuruTarif5: Add salt, black pepper, and optionally red pepper flakes. Stir and cook until the paste's aroma is released.
etliKuruTarif6: Add the soaked and drained beans to the pot. Add enough hot water to cover them and stir.
etliKuruTarif7: Cover the pot and simmer on low heat until the beans are tender. This usually takes between 45 minutes and 1 hour. Remember to stir occasionally.
etliKuruTarif8: Once the beans are tender, remove from heat and let it rest for a few minutes.
etliKuruTarif9: Serve hot with rice and pickles. Enjoy your meal!
guvec4: 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil or olive oil
guvecTarif1: Wash and drain the green beans.
guvecTarif2: Add vegetable oil or olive oil to a casserole or deep pot. Add the chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.
guvecTarif3: Add the grated or chopped tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally.
guvecTarif4: Add the spices (salt, black pepper, sugar) and mix well.
guvecTarif5: Add the washed green beans on top of the prepared sauce.
guvecTarif6: Add the hot water, stir, and cover the casserole.
guvecTarif7: Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for about 45-60 minutes, or until the beans are tender. Check occasionally and add more water if needed.
guvecTarif8: Remove the casserole from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.
beyaz5: 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil or butter
beyaz9: Optional: 1 teaspoon of red pepper flakes, 1 teaspoon of cumin
beyazTarif1: Soak the chickpeas in water overnight and let them sit until morning. If you don't have time, you can quickly boil them as well.
beyazTarif2: In a pot, add vegetable oil or butter. Once the oil is heated, add the finely chopped onion and sauté until it turns golden brown.
beyazTarif3: Add the tomato paste and continue to sauté until its aroma is released.
beyazTarif4: Add the grated tomatoes and stir while cooking.
beyazTarif5: Add salt, black pepper, and optionally red pepper flakes and cumin.
beyazTarif6: Add the soaked and drained chickpeas to the pot.
beyazTarif7: Add enough hot water to cover the chickpeas and stir.
beyazTarif8: Cover the pot and cook on low heat until the chickpeas are tender. This can take approximately 45 minutes to 1 hour. Remember to stir occasionally.
beyazTarif9: Once the chickpeas are tender, remove from heat and let it rest for a while.
tavuklu6: 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil or butter
tavuklu10: Optional: 1 teaspoon of red pepper flakes, 1 teaspoon of cumin
tavukluTarif1: Soak the chickpeas in water overnight and leave them until morning. If you're short on time, you can also quickly boil them.
tavukluTarif2: Add vegetable oil or butter to a pot. Once the oil is heated, add the finely chopped onion and sauté until it turns golden.
tavukluTarif3: Add the diced chicken breast and cook until the chicken is fully cooked.
tavukluTarif4: Add the tomato paste and continue to cook until the raw smell disappears.
tavukluTarif5: Add the grated tomatoes and stir while cooking.
tavukluTarif6: Add salt, black pepper, and optionally red pepper flakes and cumin.
tavukluTarif7: Add the soaked and drained chickpeas to the pot.
tavukluTarif8: Add enough hot water to cover the chickpeas and stir.
tavukluTarif9: Cover the pot and cook on low heat until the chickpeas and chicken are tender. This usually takes about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Remember to stir occasionally.
tavukluTarif10: Once the chickpeas and chicken are tender, remove from heat and let it rest for a while.
kocbasi5: 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil or butter
kocbasi9: Optional: 1 teaspoon of red pepper flakes, 1 teaspoon of cumin
kocbasiTarif1: Soak the chickpeas in water overnight and leave them until morning. If you're short on time, you can also quickly boil them.
kocbasiTarif2: Add vegetable oil or butter to a pot. Once the oil is heated, add the finely chopped onion and sauté until it turns golden.
kocbasiTarif3: Add the tomato paste and continue to cook until the raw smell disappears.
kocbasiTarif4: Add the grated tomatoes and stir while cooking.
kocbasiTarif5: Add salt, black pepper, and optionally red pepper flakes and cumin.
kocbasiTarif6: Add the soaked and drained chickpeas to the pot.
kocbasiTarif7: Add enough hot water to cover the chickpeas and stir.
kocbasiTarif8: Cover the pot and cook on low heat until the chickpeas are tender. This usually takes about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Remember to stir occasionally.
kocbasiTarif9: Once the chickpeas are tender, remove from heat and let it rest for a while.
nohut6: 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil or butter
nohutTarif1: Soak the chickpeas in water overnight and leave them until morning. If you're short on time, you can also quickly boil them.
nohutTarif2: Heat vegetable oil or butter in a casserole dish. Once the oil is heated, add the finely chopped onion and sauté until it turns golden.
nohutTarif3: Add the cubed lamb meat and cook until the meat is fully browned.
nohutTarif4: Add the tomato paste and continue to cook until the raw smell disappears.
nohutTarif5: Add the grated tomatoes and stir while cooking.
nohutTarif6: Add salt, black pepper, and optionally red pepper flakes and cumin.
nohutTarif7: Add the soaked and drained chickpeas to the casserole dish.
nohutTarif8: Add enough hot water to cover the chickpeas and meat, and stir.
nohutTarif9: Cover the casserole dish and cook on low heat until the chickpeas and meat are tender. This usually takes about 1 hour. Remember to stir occasionally.
nohutTarif10: Once the chickpeas and meat are tender, remove from heat and let it rest for a while.
yesilMercimek6: 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil or butter
yesilMercimekTarif1: Rinse the green lentils and place them in a pot. Add enough water to cover them and bring to a boil. Once boiling, drain the water and set the lentils aside.
yesilMercimekTarif2: Add vegetable oil or butter to a pot. Once the oil is heated, add the finely chopped onion and sauté until it turns golden.
yesilMercimekTarif3: Add the minced garlic and cook for a few more minutes.
yesilMercimekTarif4: Add the tomato paste and continue to cook until the raw smell disappears.
yesilMercimekTarif5: Add the grated tomatoes and stir while cooking.
yesilMercimekTarif6: Add salt, black pepper, and optionally red pepper flakes and cumin.
yesilMercimekTarif7: Add the boiled green lentils to the pot and mix.
yesilMercimekTarif8: Add enough hot water to cover the lentils and stir.
yesilMercimekTarif9: Cover the pot and cook on low heat until the lentils are tender. This usually takes about 30-40 minutes. Remember to stir occasionally.
yesilMercimekTarif10: Once the lentils are tender, remove from heat and let it rest for a while.
yesilIspanakTarif1: Rinse the green lentils and place them in a pot. Add enough water to cover them and bring to a boil. Once boiling, drain the water and set the lentils aside.
yesilIspanakTarif2: Thoroughly wash and chop the spinach.
yesilIspanakTarif3: Add vegetable oil to a pot. Once the oil is heated, add the finely chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
yesilIspanakTarif4: Add the minced garlic and cook for a few more minutes.
yesilIspanakTarif5: Add the tomato paste and pepper paste (if using), and cook until fragrant.
yesilIspanakTarif6: Add the green lentils to the pot and stir.
yesilIspanakTarif7: Add the chopped spinach and cook, stirring occasionally.
yesilIspanakTarif8: Season with salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes.
yesilIspanakTarif9: As the dish cooks and the liquid reduces, gradually add hot water as needed. Simmer on low heat until the lentils and spinach are tender.
yesilIspanakTarif10: Once the lentils and spinach are soft, remove from heat and let it rest for a few minutes.
yesilKofteTarif1: Rinse the green lentils and place them in a pot. Add enough water to cover them and boil until tender. After boiling, drain the water and set the lentils aside.
yesilKofteTarif2: Place the fine bulgur in a bowl and add 1 cup of hot water. Let the bulgur swell for 10 minutes.
yesilKofteTarif3: Heat vegetable oil in a pan. Add the finely chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
yesilKofteTarif4: Add the minced garlic and cook for a few more minutes.
yesilKofteTarif5: Add tomato paste and pepper paste, and continue cooking until fragrant.
yesilKofteTarif6: Add the boiled green lentils and mix. Add salt, black pepper, cumin, and red pepper flakes.
yesilKofteTarif7: Add this mixture to the swollen bulgur and mix well.
yesilKofteTarif8: Add finely chopped parsley and green onions. Add lemon juice and mix all the ingredients thoroughly.
yesilKofteTarif9: Wet your hands lightly, take small portions of the mixture, and shape them into patties.
yesilKofteTarif10: Place the prepared green lentil patties on a serving plate.
barbunyaTarif1: Soak the kidney beans in water overnight and let them sit until morning. After soaking, drain the water and boil the beans in fresh water. After boiling, drain and set aside.
barbunyaTarif2: Add olive oil to a pot and heat it. Add the finely chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
barbunyaTarif3: Add the garlic and cook for a few more minutes.
barbunyaTarif4: Add the chopped carrots and cook for a few minutes. Then add the diced potatoes and continue to sauté.
barbunyaTarif5: Add tomato paste and cook until fragrant. Add the grated tomatoes and mix well.
barbunyaTarif6: Add the boiled kidney beans and mix. Add salt, black pepper, and granulated sugar.
barbunyaTarif7: Add enough hot water to cover the beans. Cover the pot and cook over low heat until the beans are tender.
barbunyaTarif8: After cooking, remove from heat and add finely chopped parsley.
barbunyaTarif9: Serve the kidney bean stew warm or cold. Enjoy your meal!
kirazTarif1: Soak the kidney beans in water overnight and let them sit until morning. After soaking, drain the water and boil the beans in fresh water. After boiling, drain and set aside.
kirazTarif2: Add olive oil to a pot and heat it. Add the finely chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
kirazTarif3: Add the garlic and cook for a few more minutes.
kirazTarif4: Add the chopped carrots and cook for a few minutes. Then add the diced potatoes and continue to sauté.
kirazTarif5: Add tomato paste and cook until fragrant. Add the grated tomatoes and mix well.
kirazTarif6: Add the boiled kidney beans and mix. Add salt, black pepper, and granulated sugar.
kirazTarif7: Add enough hot water to cover the beans. Cover the pot and cook over low heat until the beans are tender.
kirazTarif8: After cooking, remove from heat and add finely chopped parsley.
kirazTarif9: Serve the kidney bean stew warm or cold. Enjoy your meal!
bulgurluTarif1: Place the fine bulgur in a large bowl and add the hot water. Cover and let the bulgur swell for 10-15 minutes.
bulgurluTarif2: Add the ground meat to the swollen bulgur. Add the finely chopped onion, egg, tomato paste, pepper paste, salt, black pepper, and cumin.
bulgurluTarif3: Knead the mixture to prepare the köfte mixture. Take small pieces of the mixture, roll them into balls, and shape them into köftes.
bulgurluTarif4: Heat the olive oil in a pan and cook the köftes until both sides are browned.
bulgurluTarif5: Place the cooked köftes on a serving plate and sprinkle finely chopped parsley on top.
bulgurluTarif6: Serve the bulgur köftes hot. Enjoy your meal!
yaprakTarif1: Dip the grape leaves in boiling water for 1-2 minutes and let them drain in a colander.
yaprakTarif2: Rinse and drain the rice. Finely chop the onions and sauté them in olive oil. Add the rice and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
yaprakTarif3: Add the chopped parsley, dill, dried mint, black pepper, salt, and cinnamon. Add the tomato paste and mix well.
yaprakTarif4: Remove the mixture from the heat and let it cool slightly.
yaprakTarif5: Place a small amount of the filling in the center of each leaf and roll them tightly.
yaprakTarif6: Arrange the rolled leaves in a pot. Place lemon slices on top and add 2 cups of water.
yaprakTarif7: Place a plate on top of the leaves and cover the pot with a lid. Cook on low heat for about 45 minutes.
yaprakTarif8: Let the stuffed grape leaves cool and serve. Enjoy your meal!
yalanciTarif1: Place the bulgur in a large bowl and add the hot water. Cover and let it sit for 10-15 minutes to allow the bulgur to swell.
yalanciTarif2: Grate the onion and garlic. Add them to the swollen bulgur.
yalanciTarif3: Add tomato paste, pepper paste, olive oil, salt, cumin, black pepper, red pepper flakes, and isot pepper. Knead well.
yalanciTarif4: Add chopped parsley and green onions. Add the lemon juice and continue kneading.
yalanciTarif5: Take small pieces of the mixture and shape them with your hands.
yalanciTarif6: Serve the fake çiğ köfte with lettuce leaves and lemon slices. Enjoy your meal!
asureTarif1: Wash the wheat and place it in a large pot. Add enough water to cover it and let it soak overnight.
asureTarif2: Soak the chickpeas and kidney beans in separate bowls of water overnight. The next day, cook the chickpeas and kidney beans separately.
asureTarif3: Drain the soaked wheat and add fresh water to the pot. Cook the wheat until tender.
asureTarif4: Chop the dried apricots, dried figs, and raisins into small pieces and soak them in hot water.
asureTarif5: Add the cooked chickpeas and kidney beans to the cooked wheat. Add the water and mix.
asureTarif6: Add the chopped apricots, figs, and raisins to the mixture. Add the sugar and stir.
asureTarif7: Add the milk and continue to simmer the mixture over low heat.
asureTarif8: Add the orange zest, hazelnuts, walnuts, and almonds. Stir and cook for a few more minutes.
asureTarif9: Divide the aşure into bowls and garnish with pomegranate seeds and cinnamon.
asureTarif10: Cool the aşure before serving. Enjoy your meal!
